awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Applied Mathematics of Transport     Theory
awd_abstract_narration: This research will study initial-boundary value problems                   arising in kinetic reference theory, especially equations of                    Boltzmann, Enskog, B.G.K., and various modifications.  Existence,               uniqueness, regularity and asymptotic properties are sought.                    Professors Zweifel and Greenberg will continue the development of               perturbation theory for co-bisemigroups, especially in the Banach               space setting, and the related Wiener-Hopf factorization theory.                Explicit application to certain linearized transport equations is               also proposed.  Numerical simulation applied to the Vlasov-                     Poisson system, to mumesonic transport, and to scaling properties               of dynamical systems is intended.  These studies are foundations                for application in areas such as radiative transfer, neutron                    transport, and rarefied gas dynamics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
